algorithm

Stack Practiceby Jian

This is a naive implementation of Stack which mainly used to add or remove element from front or end side.


#include<iostream>

using std::cout;

class Stack {
private:
  struct Node {
    int val;
    Node * next;
    Node() : val(0), next(NULL) {}
    Node(int v) : val(v), next(NULL) {}
  };
  Node * top;
  int len;
public:
   Stack() : top(NULL), len(0) {}

   Stack(int v) : top(new Node(v)), len(1) {}

   ~ Stack() {
     Node * temp;
     while (top != NULL) {
       temp = top;
       top = top -> next;
       delete temp;
     }
     temp = NULL;
   }

   void push(int v) {
    if (isEmpty()) {
      top = new Node(v);
    } else {
      Node * temp = top;
      top = new Node(v);
      top->next = temp;
      temp = NULL;
    }
    len++;
   }

   int pop() {
     if (isEmpty()) return -1;
     Node * temp = top;
     top = top -> next;
     int v = temp -> val;
     delete temp;
     len--;
     return v;
   }

   int size() const {
     return len;
   }

   int peek() const {
     if (len == 0) return -1;
     return top -> val;
   }

   bool isEmpty() {
     return len == 0;
   }

   void display() {
     Node * curr = top;
     while(curr != NULL) {
       cout << curr -> val << " ";
       curr = curr -> next;
     }
     curr = NULL;
   }
 };

 int main() {
   Stack stk;
   for (int i = 0; i < 20; i++) {
     stk.push(i);
   }
   for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++) {
     stk.pop();
   }
   cout << stk.peek() << "\n";
   stk.display();
   return 0;
 }
